description: The Department of National Defence has a requirement to provide Repair, Overhaul and Upgrade, Demilitarization and acquire Chassis electrical components for the Leopard 2 Main Battle Tank.
full_summary:
## Tender Notice - Repairs and Overhaul of Leopard 2 Main Battle Tank Chassis Electrical Components

**Contract Reference:** W8486-249318

**Publication Date:** November 15, 2023

**Tender Closing Date:** January 15, 2024, at 16:00:00

The Department of National Defence invites eligible bidders to submit proposals for the repair, overhaul, and upgrade of the electrical components of the Leopard 2 Main Battle Tank chassis.

**Scope of Work:**

- Maintenance Support, Repair, and Overhaul (R&O) and Upgrade, including inspection, disassembly, repair, overhaul, reassembly, testing, and utilization of original equipment manufacturer (OEM) parts.
- Mandatory Upgrade: NSN 2920-12-178-5320, Generator Engine; NSN 2510-12-311-6119, Panel Vehicular Operational; NSN 2910-12-198-5265, Fuel Pump Electrical; NSN 4810-12-176-9916, Valve Assembly; and NSN 2940-12-178-4812, Fan, Air Intake must be upgraded to the latest OEM configuration.
- Repair and Overhaul of the following components: NSN 2920-12-330-6170, Generator Engine; NSN 2920-12-178-5739, Starter, Engine; and NSN 2920-12-180-0095, Voltage Regulator, among others.

**Security Requirements:**

- This procurement is subject to the Controlled Goods Program and the Industrial Security Program (ISP) of Public Works and Government Services Canada.
- Security requirements are outlined in Part 1 – General Information and Part 6 – Resulting Contract Clauses.

**Procurement Details:**

- Notice Type: Request for Proposal
- Procurement Method: Competitive - Open Bidding
- Procurement Category: SRVTGD
- Evaluation Criteria: Technical Merit and Price

**Submission Requirements:**

- Proposals must be submitted in either English or French.
- Documents may be submitted in electronic format via the Canada Buys website.

**Contact Information:**

- Eric Lefebvre, Contracting Authority, at (613) 406-1392 or eric.lefebvre@forces.gc.ca.

**Important Notes:**

- The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
- This procurement is subject to the rules and regulations of the Government
